sourceMeaningMnemonic: At this <radical>gate</radical> you're trying to get some <radical>beans</radical> through, but the <radical>measurements</radical> were off and you're starting to <kanji>struggle</kanji>. No matter how you push or pull these beans, they're just too big to get through the gate.
meaningInfo: "I'm really struggling here, I thought you said you measured these beans?" you ask the bean seller. "I did! I mean, I struggled with the measurements, I'm not very good at math..." Ugh.
readingMnemonic: You continue to <kanji>struggle</kanji> because you need to get these beans to the other side of the gate and into <ja><reading>とう</reading>きょう</ja>. You usually struggle a little when people want to bring things through the gate to <ja>とうきょう</ja>, but this is ridiculous.
readingInfo: "How am I supposed to sell my beans if you struggle this much just to get them into <ja>とうきょう</ja>!" the bean seller shouts. It's making you struggle more, and beans start falling on your head, ripping their way out of their sack.
